name: Oregon National Guard State Tuition Assistance (ONGSTA)
description: 100% tuition at resident rates plus fees and book allowance for Oregon National Guard members. Private schools receive up to $274 per credit hour. Maximum of 90-180 credits depending on degree level.
eligibility: Active Oregon National Guard member in good standing
benefit_amount: 100% tuition at resident rates + fees + book allowance; up to $274/credit at private schools
how_to_apply: Apply through Oregon Student Aid - oregonstudentaid.gov

name: In-State Tuition for ALL Veterans
description: In-state tuition rates at all Oregon public institutions for ANY veteran regardless of state of residence. Applies to veterans using GI Bill benefits or paying out-of-pocket.
eligibility: Using VA education benefits OR paying own tuition
how_to_apply: Submit DD-214 to institution's veterans office

name: Dependent Tuition Waiver Program
description: 100% tuition waiver at Oregon public institutions for children and spouses of 100% disabled or KIA veterans.
eligibility: Dependent or spouse of Oregon veteran
Veteran must be 100% P&T disabled OR killed in action
Veteran must have been Oregon resident
how_to_apply: Apply through Oregon Department of Veterans' Affairs with VA documentation

name: Oregon Veterans' Educational Bridge Grant
description: $5,000 grant to help student veterans transition to higher education. Can be used for tuition, fees, books, or living expenses.

name: Voyager Program
description: Priority registration and enhanced support services for veterans who served in combat zones. Provides academic advising, career counseling, and wraparound support.
eligibility: Veteran who served in combat zone

name: Disabled Veterans Property Tax Exemption
description: $23,000 to $28,000 property tax exemption for veterans with 40% or higher service-connected disability rating. Amount increases with disability percentage.
benefit_amount: $23,000-$28,000 assessed value exemption based on disability rating
how_to_apply: File with county assessor annually with VA rating documentation

name: 100% Property Tax Exemption for 65+ and 100% Disabled
description: 100% property tax exemption for veterans who are both age 65 or older AND 100% disabled. Applies to primary residence and up to one acre of land.
benefit_amount: 100% property tax exemption on home + 1 acre
how_to_apply: Apply through county assessor with age and VA disability proof

name: Active Duty Property Tax Exemption
description: Property tax exemption for service members on active duty for 178 or more consecutive days in a year.
benefit_amount: Property tax exemption during active duty deployment
how_to_apply: File with county assessor with military orders

name: Property Tax Deferral for Disabled Veterans
description: Property tax deferral program allows disabled veterans to defer property taxes with minimal interest, preventing foreclosure due to tax burden.
benefit_amount: Defer property taxes with low interest rate
how_to_apply: Apply through Oregon Department of Revenue

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption
description: All military retirement pay is fully exempt from Oregon state income tax.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on all military retirement income
how_to_apply: Exclude from Oregon income tax return

name: Veterans Preference in State Employment
description: 5-10 point preference on state employment exams for veterans. Disabled veterans receive 10 points, all other veterans receive 5 points.
how_to_apply: Submit veteran preference form with DD-214 when applying for state jobs

name: Professional Licensing Credit for Military Experience
description: Oregon grants professional licensing credit and fee waivers for veterans whose military training and experience relates to civilian licensing requirements.
eligibility: Military training/experience relevant to Oregon license
benefit_amount: Expedited licensing + fee waivers + experience credit
how_to_apply: Apply through relevant Oregon licensing board with military credentials

name: Free Hunting and Fishing Licenses
description: FREE lifetime hunting and fishing licenses for 100% disabled Oregon veterans.
eligibility: Apply through Oregon Fish and Wildlife
benefit_amount: FREE lifetime hunting and fishing licenses
how_to_apply: Apply through Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife with VA disability documentation
source_name: Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife

name: Free Camping for Disabled Veterans
description: Free camping at Oregon state parks for disabled veterans with 50% or higher disability rating.
eligibility: Oregon State Parks veteran camping permit
benefit_amount: Free camping at all Oregon state parks
how_to_apply: Obtain veteran camping permit from Oregon Parks and Recreation

name: Emergency Financial Assistance Grants
description: Emergency grants for Oregon veterans facing financial hardship including rent, utilities, medical bills, and transportation costs.
benefit_amount: Varies by need - typically $500-$3,000 per emergency
how_to_apply: Contact Oregon Department of Veterans' Affairs county office

name: Oregon Veterans' Homes
description: Two state-operated veterans' homes providing skilled nursing care and domiciliary care at reduced rates for eligible veterans. Located in The Dalles and Lebanon.
eligibility: Need for nursing or domiciliary care
benefit_amount: Subsidized long-term care (rates vary by income)
how_to_apply: Contact Oregon Department of Veterans' Affairs for application

name: Oregon Veterans' Home Loan Program
description: Low-interest home loans for Oregon veterans with competitive rates and reduced fees. Available for purchase, construction, or refinancing.
how_to_apply: Apply through Oregon Department of Veterans' Affairs

name: Veteran License Plates and Parking Placards
description: Special veteran license plates and disabled veteran parking placards. Disabled veteran plates provide special parking privileges.
benefit_amount: Special license plates + disabled veteran parking privileges
how_to_apply: Apply through Oregon DMV with DD-214 and disability documentation if applicable
